com.dotmarketing.viewtools.content

Class BinaryMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dotmarketing.viewtools.content.BinaryMap

  • public class BinaryMap
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class to provide an object to return to the dotCMS when a content has a binary field
    Since:
    1.9.1.3
    Author:
    Jason Tesser

      java.lang.String getResizeUri(java.lang.Integer width, java.lang.Integer height)
      Either width or height are required, if one of those is not passed then the image will be resized proportionally to preserve its aspect ratio, otherwise both parameters will be used the image could look stretched.
      java.lang.String getSize()
      The size of the actual raw file
      java.lang.String getThumbnailUri()
      Either w (width) or h (height) are required, if one of those is not passed then the image will be resized proportionally to preserve its aspect ratio, and the background color parameter will not be used If both width and height are passed, then the background color parameter could be used to preserver the aspect ratio and generate bands to respect the passed width and height, if no background color is passed then white will be used by default.

      This is a convince method/helper method to build the URI for the thumbnail exporter.

      • getResizeUri

        public java.lang.String getResizeUri()
        This is a convince method/helper method to build the URI for the resize exporter. You may pass any of the parameters as null, or 0
        Either width or height are required, if one of those is not passed then the image will be resized proportionally to preserve its aspect ratio, otherwise both parameters will be used the image could look stretched.
        Returns:
        the resizeUri

      • getResizeUri

        public java.lang.String getResizeUri(java.lang.Integer width,
                            java.lang.Integer height)
        Either width or height are required, if one of those is not passed then the image will be resized proportionally to preserve its aspect ratio, otherwise both parameters will be used the image could look stretched.
        Parameters:
        width - Width to resize to
        height - Height to resize to

      • getThumbnailUri

        public java.lang.String getThumbnailUri()
        Either w (width) or h (height) are required, if one of those is not passed then the image will be resized proportionally to preserve its aspect ratio, and the background color parameter will not be used If both width and height are passed, then the background color parameter could be used to preserver the aspect ratio and generate bands to respect the passed width and height, if no background color is passed then white will be used by default.

      • getThumbnailUri

        public java.lang.String getThumbnailUri(java.lang.Integer width,
                               java.lang.Integer height,
                               java.lang.String background)
        This is a convince method/helper method to build the URI for the thumbnail exporter. You may pass any of the parameters as null, empty or 0 in the case of ints.
        Either w (width) or h (height) are required, if one of those is not passed then the image will be resized proportionally to preserve its aspect ratio, and the background color parameter will not be used If both width and height are passed, then the background color parameter could be used to preserver the aspect ratio and generate bands to respect the passed width and height, if no background color is passed then white will be used by default.
        Parameters:
        width - Width to resize to
        height - Height to resize to
        background - RGB so ie.. WHITE is 255255255
        Returns:

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        This is the underneath Java File. Becareful when working with this object as you can manipulate it.
        Returns:
        the file
